keyTakeAways: Nicholas Rossi, a 38-year-old man, was sentenced to a prison term of five years to life for first-degree rape in Utah.
Rossi is described as a 'serial abuser of women' and a 'flight risk,' with multiple aliases and efforts to evade law enforcement.
He allegedly faked his death in 2020, which was revealed when an online obituary claimed his death, but police and family members raised doubts.
He was identified through a DNA match in a rape kit backlog, leading to a decade-long search and international arrest in Scotland.
Rossi used aliases including Arthur Knight and claimed to be an Irish orphan, but investigators found at least a dozen false identities.
He was previously convicted in Ohio for sex-related charges and is wanted in Rhode Island for failing to register as a sex offender.
The victim described the trauma of being raped and the financial and emotional manipulation she experienced during the relationship.
The case underscores the importance of addressing rape kit backlogs and the dangers of individuals fleeing justice by faking death or using false identities.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Utah judge sentenced Nicholas Rossi, a 38-year-old man with a history of sexual abuse and identity fraud, to five years to life in prison for first-degree rape. Rossi, whose legal name is Nicholas Alahverdian, was identified through a decade-old DNA match in a rape kit backlog. After allegedly faking his death in 2020 with a false obituary and using false identities including Arthur Knight, he was arrested in Scotland in 2023 and extradited to Utah in January 2024. He was convicted in two separate cases involving two women, one of whom was manipulated into a relationship through a Craigslist ad. Rossi claimed innocence, asserting the women were lying, but was found guilty by juries. The case highlights the dangers of flight risks and the importance of addressing rape kit backlogs and cross-jurisdictional law enforcement efforts.
title: Man Accused of Faking His Own Death and Fleeing the US After Rape Charges Gets at Least Five Years in Prison
